xxl.core.cursors.visual
Class IteratorControllable

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.visual.IteratorControllable
All Implemented Interfaces:
Controllable
public class IteratorControllable
extends java.lang.Object
implements Controllable

A controllable iterator wraps an iterator in order to enhance it by the possibility to be controlled remotely. A thread is used to control the wrapped iterator and command to the remotely controled iterator can be sent via an asynchronous channel.

See Also:
Controllable, Iterator, Thread, AsynchronousChannel

Field Summary
protected  AsynchronousChannel channel
          An asynchronous channelused for the communication between the controll thread and this class.
protected  java.util.Iterator iterator
          The iterator to be controlled remotely.
protected  java.lang.Object next
          The element returned by the last call to the next method of the remotely controlled iterator.
protected  java.lang.Thread thread
          The thread controlling the wrapped iterator.

Constructor Detail

IteratorControllable

public IteratorControllable(java.util.Iterator iterator)
Creates a new controllable iterator that enhances the given iterator by the possibility to be controlled remotely.

Parameters:
iterator - the iterator to be controlled remotely.
Method Detail

init

public void init()
Initializes a controllable iterator and prepares for the start of its life cycle. In detail, a thread controlling the wrapped iterator and an asynchronous channel for communicating with this thread are created.

Specified by:
init in interface Controllable

go

public void go()
Starts or resumes the life cycle of a controllable object. In detail, the status of the thread controlling the wrapped iterator is set to RUN.

Specified by:
go in interface Controllable

pause

public void pause()
Pauses the life cycle of a controllable object. In detail, the status of the thread controlling the wrapped iterator is set to PAUSE.

Specified by:
pause in interface Controllable

go

public void go(int steps)
Lets a controllable object perfom a given number of steps of its life cycle (optional operation). In detail, the status of the thread controlling the wrapped iterator is set to NEXT and the number of step the iterator should proceed is submitted.

Specified by:
go in interface Controllable
Parameters:
steps - the number of steps the controllable object will be allowed to resume its life cycle.
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the go(int) operation is not supported by the controllable object.

supportsGoSteps

public boolean supportsGoSteps()
Indicates whether the controllable object supports the go(int) operation or not.

Specified by:
supportsGoSteps in interface Controllable
Returns:
true if the controllable object supports the go(int) operation, otherwise false.

reset

public void reset()
           throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Resets the controllable object to the beginning of its life cycle (optional operation). This operation is not supported

Specified by:
reset in interface Controllable
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the reset operation is not supported by the controllable object.

supportsReset

public boolean supportsReset()
Indicates whether the controllable object supports the reset operation or not.

Specified by:

Returns:
true if the controllable object supports the reset operation, otherwise false.

close

public void close()
           throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Closes the controllable object and releases ressources collected during its life cycle (optional operation). This operation is not supported.

Indicates whether the controllable object supports the close operation or not.
